name: The Landlord Tales
description:
Your Tenants love their Air Conditioners a bit too much ... With unpredictable temperatures outside, you'll need to make sure and keep your tenants Air Conditioners working in order to keep them happy, otherwise they might pack their bags and find another place to live.

The more a tenant uses their Air Conditioner, the more likely it is to break down, so keep an eye out, and make sure to repair it quickly, before they complain too much.

When all the tenants have left the building, the game is over, but remember, repairs cost money, so keep an eye on your cash, and wait until the 1st of each month for a rent check from all remaining tenants.

Controls:

 - ESC (Quit)
 - Left-Mouse (Interact)

Credits:

Game was submitted for 72-hour #GodotJam Game Jam.

Art/Design/Programming: Kris Michael (http://twitter.com/krismichael) 
Fonts: Google Fonts (http://google.com/fonts/) 
Engine: Godot Engine (http://godotengine.org/) 

Source:

Source files: https://github.com/krismichael/the-landlord-tales

You are free to download, and use any of the files you want, but please keep in mind that as of Version 1.0.0 the code is very sloppy, given the 72-hour deadline for this game jam. Future versions, will be improved.

Additional:

Suggestions are always welcome, as this project will be updated into a full game after the #GodotJam judging is completed. Additional platform and language support will also be added at a later date.

Potential Upcoming Features

- Select a variety of available buildings to renovate and rent out.
- Hire staff to manage repairs and bill collections.
- Set and negotiate rental prices with new tenants based on demand.
- Online Leaderboards to see how your friends are doing.
- Random events such as fires, floods, squatters, and more.
- Build your rental empire and dominate the rental market in your city.
